django.utils.datetime_safe

Classes

date

Concrete date type.

datetime

datetime(year, month, day[, hour[, minute[, second[, microsecond[,tzinfo]]]]])

Functions

new_date(d)

Generate a safe date from a datetime.date object.

new_datetime(d)

Generate a safe datetime from a datetime.date or datetime.datetime object.

strftime(dt, fmt)

Module Contents

class django.utils.datetime_safe.date[source]

Bases: datetime.date

Concrete date type.

Constructors:

__new__() fromtimestamp() today() fromordinal()

Operators:

__repr__, __str__ __eq__, __le__, __lt__, __ge__, __gt__, __hash__ __add__, __radd__, __sub__ (add/radd only with timedelta arg)

Methods:

timetuple() toordinal() weekday() isoweekday(), isocalendar(), isoformat() ctime() strftime()

Properties (readonly): year, month, day

strftime(fmt)[source]

Format using strftime().

Example: “%d/%m/%Y, %H:%M:%S”

class django.utils.datetime_safe.datetime[source]

Bases: datetime.datetime

datetime(year, month, day[, hour[, minute[, second[, microsecond[,tzinfo]]]]])

The year, month and day arguments are required. tzinfo may be None, or an instance of a tzinfo subclass. The remaining arguments may be ints.

strftime(fmt)[source]

Format using strftime().

Example: “%d/%m/%Y, %H:%M:%S”

classmethod combine(date, time)[source]

Construct a datetime from a given date and a given time.

date()[source]

Return the date part.

django.utils.datetime_safe.new_date(d)[source]

Generate a safe date from a datetime.date object.

django.utils.datetime_safe.new_datetime(d)[source]

Generate a safe datetime from a datetime.date or datetime.datetime object.
